description: From mega- (prefix meaning ‘very large, great’) +‎ -lith (suffix meaning ‘stone’) +‎ -ic (suffix meaning ‘of or pertaining to’, forming adjectives from nouns), probably modelled after monolithic; according to the Oxford English Dictionary the word is first attested earlier than megalith. It is analysable as megalith +‎ -ic.

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to megaliths, to the people who made them, or to the period when they were made.
